meanings_and_examples.example: We’re having a bit of a do on Saturday to celebrate my birthday.
Nice do!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something that can or should be done (usually in the phrase dos and don'ts).
meanings_and_examples.example: In order to maintain a safe work environment, it is essential for employees to follow the company's dos and don'ts, which include 'dos' such as wearing safety gear and following procedures, and 'don'ts', like using unauthorized tools.
Volunteering at the local soup kitchen is a noble do that helps feed those in need.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ado; bustle; stir; to-do; A period of confusion or argument.
meanings_and_examples.example: The week leading up to the family reunion was a do, with everyone trying to coordinate travel plans and activities.
He tried to do the trick by selling fake lottery tickets.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An act of swindling; a fraud or deception.
meanings_and_examples.example: The con artist tried to do a scam by selling fake lottery tickets.
Do you like coffee?
All you ever do is surf the Internet. What will you do this afternoon?
She managed to convince her friend to join the gym by persistently encouraging him over several weeks.
it’s not the best broom, but it will have to do;  this will do me, thanks.
It simply will not do to have dozens of children running around such a quiet event.
The fresh air did him some good.
Our relationship isn't doing very well;  how do you do?

meanings_and_examples.definition: (chiefly in questions) To have as one's job.
meanings_and_examples.example: What does Bob do? — He's a plumber.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To perform the tasks or actions associated with (something).
meanings_and_examples.example: "Don't forget to do your report" means something quite different depending on whether you're a student or a programmer.
I'll just do some eggs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To travel in, to tour, to make a circuit of.
meanings_and_examples.example: Let’s do New York also.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To treat in a certain way.
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to do her best on the exam, even though it was challenging.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To work for or on, by way of caring for, looking after, preparing, cleaning, keeping in order, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to do her laundry early in the morning before starting her day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To act or behave in a certain manner; to conduct oneself.
meanings_and_examples.example: In order to maintain professionalism, she made sure to always 'do' her best during meetings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To spend (time) in jail. (See also do time)
meanings_and_examples.example: I did five years for armed robbery.
They really laughed when he did Clinton, with a perfect accent and a leer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (with 'a' and the name of a person, place, event, etc.) To copy or emulate the actions or behaviour that is associated with the person or thing mentioned.
meanings_and_examples.example: He did a Henry VIII and got married six times.
In a fit of rage, he couldn't control his actions and ended up 'doing' the victim.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To deal with for good and all; to finish up; to undo; to ruin; to do for.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the team failed in multiple attempts, they had no choice but to completely 'do' away with their project.
He got done for speeding.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have sex with. (See also do it)
meanings_and_examples.example: John asked Mary if she wanted to go home and 'do' after the party.
That guy just did me out of two hundred bucks!

meanings_and_examples.definition: To convert into a certain form; especially, to translate.
meanings_and_examples.example: the novel has just been done into English;  I'm going to do this play into a movie
She decided to do her homework before going out with friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To work as a domestic servant (with for).
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to do housekeeping for Mr. and Mrs. Johnson in exchange for room and board.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (auxiliary) Used to form the present progressive of verbs.
meanings_and_examples.example: Right now, I am doing my homework.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cash or to advance money for, as a bill or note.
meanings_and_examples.example: I went to the bank to cash my paycheck. The teller gave me the requested amount in exchange for the check.
Could you do me a burger with mayonnaise instead of ketchup?
After attempting to lift the heavy box without proper form, he ended up doing his back.
I do cocaine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (in the form be doing [somewhere]) To exist with a purpose or for a reason.
meanings_and_examples.example: What's that car doing in our swimming pool?
